newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares recover after FOMC, more gains seen.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares recover after FOMC, more gains seen.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher on Wednesday after a nervous start prompted by the U.S. rate hike with dealers seeing the more positive trend continuing after the Easter break.
"We seem to have broken the negative trend and can look forward now to more gains next week," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed a solid 1.28 point higher at 154.58 while the June KFX future rose 1.10 point to 154.10 with 40 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
The Danish stock exchange is closed for trading until Tuesday April 1 for the Easter holiday.
FLS Industries continued to make advances after its bumper 1996 result, putting on 25 crowns to finish at 845, while Carlsberg rose 12 crowns to 397 on a Coca Cola Nordic anchor bottler deal.
Overall turnover was 908 million crowns in a quiet pre-holiday market.
